channel.title: [Release]I-Bot Random
channel.description:
Just finished up a new I-Bot random for those who use it. In case you haven't guessed from the name, it checks to see if you have the V-Bright setting on, and if not it does it for you. :) It hasn't been tested yet :(, but should work like a charm. Consider yourselves the Beta-testers :P. I'd put up the source code, but since no one even knows I've been working on this, it would be VERY easy to rip the small amount of work it took. No, I don't think most of the users here would do that, but then again I don't know many of you. ;)
I attached the .CLASS file below. [size=5pt]If you're smart enough to decompile it, I assume that you're smart enough not to rip.[/size]
Please post any comments, or usage reports if you can; I could use as much feedback as I could get.
Oh, and soon enough I'll be releasing an EliteFlax0r that's gonna support two different locations, and will bank. ;)

item.title: [Release]I-Bot Random
item.dc:creator: @Exernet Exernet
item.description:
@Exernet wrote:

[quote=“Sepranem, post:3, topic:17653”]Well, it’s not really pure Java; I-Bot runs on scripts that are a kindof Java that has add-ons. It’s not really a program either because it relies on having I-Bot to run, so I don’t really think it actually “belongs” to that section.

also - what does it do -.-

->

In case you haven’t guessed from the name, it checks to see if you have the V-Bright setting on, and if not it does it for you.[/quote]

Either way, it still belongs in one of the programming forums…

Read full topic

@Sepranem wrote:

Just finished up a new I-Bot random for those who use it. In case you haven’t guessed from the name, it checks to see if you have the V-Bright setting on, and if not it does it for you. It hasn’t been tested yet :(, but should work like a charm. Consider yourselves the Beta-testers :P. I’d put up the source code, but since no one even knows I’ve been working on this, it would be VERY easy to rip the small amount of work it took.
